original_summary: To get to the conference centre early, #Person1# and #Person2# decide to take the underground, and #Person2# proposes to go there together.

transformed_conversations.personal_summary:
Here's a summary of your interactions with Emily over the past couple months regarding the conference and related events:

Back in early March, about 2 months ago, you and Emily were planning to attend a conference together at Mister Ewing's request. You decided to take the underground to arrive on time and make a good impression. The conference ended up going well, and the following week, Emily suggested meeting up to discuss potential collaboration opportunities that came out of it. In mid-April, you had a productive brainstorming session and decided to put together a joint proposal. After a few weeks of hard work, you submitted the proposal earlier this month. Just yesterday, Emily excitedly messaged you that the proposal was accepted! Looking back, that initial conference set off a chain of events that has led to an exciting new project for you and Emily to tackle together. It's amazing to see how much has progressed in a relatively short time.

messages.content: You: Mister Ewing said we should show up at the conference center at 4 o'clock, right?
Emily: Yes, he specially asked us not to be late. Some of the people from our East York branch office are coming and he wants to make a good impression on them. How are you getting there?
You: I was thinking of taking my car but I think I'm just going to take the underground because there is construction on the highway. What about you?
Emily: I'll be taking the underground as well. Why don't we go together? I've been to the conference center only once, and I'm not sure if I can find my way around there.
You: Great idea, let's plan to meet at the station at 3:30 then. See you there!
Emily: Hey, I thought the conference last week went really well! I made some great connections. Want to meet up this week to discuss any collaboration opportunities?
You: Definitely, I had a few promising conversations as well. How about we grab coffee on Thursday afternoon?
Emily: Perfect, let's meet at Cafe Luca at 2pm. Looking forward to brainstorming ideas!
You: I've been thinking more about the project idea we discussed when we met up after the conference. I really think we could put together a strong proposal. What do you think?
Emily: I'm so glad you brought that up, I haven't been able to stop thinking about it either! Let's go for it. How about we divide up the proposal sections and aim to have drafts by next Friday?
You: Sounds great, I'll start putting together an outline and project timeline. Let's touch base mid-week to see how things are progressing.
Emily: Excellent, can't wait to get started on this. I have a good feeling about it!
Emily: You'll never believe it, our proposal got accepted! They loved our idea! 🎉
You: No way, that's incredible news! I had a good feeling about this one. When do we get started?
Emily: They want to kick things off with a call next week. I'll send over the meeting details later today.
You: Fantastic, what an exciting opportunity! Looking forward to diving in and bringing this idea to life.
